lines.text: [Brannigan approaches a motorcyclist who has just thrown a bag in the Thames]
Can you swim?
Yes.
Go get it!
[pushes motorcyclist into the river]
This isn't Chicago!
You're right, you can't get a decent burger anywhere in this town.

[ordering breakfast at Swann's club]
I'll have two eggs over easy, a side of bacon, and a short stack.
Let me translate.
[to the waiter]
. That will be two eggs lightly fried on both sides, a rasher of bacon, and a modest stack of pancakes.
But not *too* modest.
Try not to loose him back in the colonies!

[after kicking down door]
Knock, knock!
Kinda strange, having a couple of cops advise you on what's in your client's best interest.
Knock it off, Brannigan. If Larkin's friends in Chicago find out I'm in bed with the Yard, they'll part my hair with a blowtorch!
'oversexed, overpaid and over here'.
I really walked into that one - and deserved it. I'm sorry.
Might we start again, sir?
Why? We're doing fine.
[Brannigan has used a revolver wrapped in a plastic bag to coerce Angell into revealing the whereabouts of Ben Larkin. Brannigan then puts the weapon on the table and telephones police headquarters]
You must be getting old, Angell, trying to push second-rate paper like this.
[Brannigan reaches the desk sergeant and doesn't notice that Angell has taken the gun in the plastic bag]
Turn around, big man!
Angell, you're a real bush-leaguer.
Oh yeah?
[Angell squeezes the gun's trigger, but it clicks empty]
Oh, you know something, I don't think it's loaded.

[flying into a rage]
Why you dirty lousy mick! You got no rules! You got no...!
[Brannigan grabs a piece of wood and clobbers Angell, who falls unconscious onto the table. Brannigan ties him up while the desk sergeant on the phone yells for him]

[to the phone]
Nice to be wanted.

[waking up]
Listen Brannigan, you're dead! There's a contract out on you!
[Brannigan tosses the empty gun on the table next to Angell]
Try explaining that to your parole officer.
How's the world's second-best navy?
You should know.
Last time I was here people were getting bombed a different way!
[Larkin employed Gorman the hitman to plant a bomb in Brannigan's flat. It has just gone off, blowing a hole in the wall through which the Albert Memorial is visible]

[ironically]
Larkin paid twenty-five grand to get me that view.
[to Brannigan]

[yells]
I've asked you politely. Now I'll ask you impolitely. Give me that gun!
